utterance.speaker: JANIE
utterance.content: Jasper hold still. Stop squirming.

utterance.speaker: DERAN
utterance.content: What did he do now?

utterance.speaker: JANIE
utterance.content: He got in another fight and I can't get his nose to stop bleeding.

utterance.speaker: DERAN
utterance.content: You have to apply much more pressure than that. You had to do this today. I got office hours, supposed to have dinner with the Dean, you just can't lash out whenever you get angry.

utterance.speaker: JASPER
utterance.content: He said I smelt like a monkey.

utterance.speaker: DERAN
utterance.content: Well you do. You can't refuse to take a bath and then hit kids who tell you that you smell. Damn.

utterance.speaker: JANIE
utterance.content: Don't you think we should call 911?

utterance.speaker: DERAN
utterance.content: No, this isn't his first nosebleed. He'll be fine.

utterance.speaker: LUCY
utterance.content: Daddy!

utterance.speaker: DERAN
utterance.content: Hey Lucy-Goosy.

utterance.speaker: LUCY
utterance.content: I'm playing doctor.

utterance.speaker: DERAN
utterance.content: So am I. Can you go back and play?

utterance.speaker: JASPER
utterance.content: Ow.

utterance.speaker: DERAN
utterance.content: When was this fight?

utterance.speaker: JANIE
utterance.content: Over 10 minutes ago.

utterance.speaker: JASPER
utterance.content: I feel dizzy.

utterance.speaker: DERAN
utterance.content: Maybe you should make that call.

utterance.speaker: JANIE
utterance.content: OK.

utterance.speaker: LUCY
utterance.content: Daddy, look. I can help.

utterance.speaker: DERAN
utterance.content: No, that's great honey. Can you just please leave Daddy alone!

utterance.speaker: JANIE
utterance.content: They're sending an ambulance.

utterance.speaker: DERAN
utterance.content: Call them back. He'll be fine. How you feeling, Bud? You light headed?

utterance.speaker: JASPER
utterance.content: Lucy.

utterance.speaker: DERAN
utterance.content: Oh, God. Lucy? Are you OK? Lucy? Lucy? Lucy? Lucy, are you OK? Lucy? Lucy?

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Oh for God's sakes. Stop! Don't move. The way the soft evening light catches your eyes. The gentle caress of the dusk on her hair as you turn around and leave my office without giving me that file.

utterance.speaker: CUDDY
utterance.content: Restrictive pericarditis.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Boring.

utterance.speaker: CUDDY
utterance.content: She's in kindergarten.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Less boring, or grandma's been held back a few years.

utterance.speaker: CUDDY
utterance.content: It's calcified and she's hypertensive.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Then get her into surgery.

utterance.speaker: CUDDY
utterance.content: She already is in surgery.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Tricky procedure. It's going to take all night. Sleep tight.

utterance.speaker: CUDDY
utterance.content: No congenital defects, no health problems, but her heart is strangling itself.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Fascinating, but since the pathology on the pericardium won't be back until after they remove it.

utterance.speaker: CUDDY
utterance.content: Get started on her blood, you can test for viral infections, bacteria...

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Round up the usual suspects. Amyloidosis, sarcoidosis, hemochromatosis... Heck, go wild, do all the osises. All taken care of, sleep tight.

utterance.speaker: FOREMAN
utterance.content: This thing is already all around her heart. If it gets into the muscle she's dead.

utterance.speaker: CHASE
utterance.content: Best bet's Coxsackie virus, Parvovirus B19, CMV...

utterance.speaker: CAMERON
utterance.content: Bacterial infection is more likely to turn constrictive. It could be TB.

utterance.speaker: CHASE
utterance.content: Right. Forgot about the part where she did time in Russian gulag. Her hematocritâ€™s elevated.

utterance.speaker: CAMERON
utterance.content: Few extra blood cells means nothing. She's probably just dehydrated.

utterance.speaker: CHASE
utterance.content: Yes and I could assume 3 or 4 things to fit my theory too.

utterance.speaker: CAMERON
utterance.content: She's sick. She obviously hasn't been drinking enough...

utterance.speaker: FOREMAN
utterance.content: Enough! I take it you two aren't sleeping together anymore? We do what House said. We test for everything.

utterance.speaker: CHASE
utterance.content: Good. Then I can go home.

utterance.speaker: CAMERON
utterance.content: Since when does we not include you?

utterance.speaker: CHASE
utterance.content: Well House is going to call us all idiots anyway. Might as well be a well-rested idiot.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: You guys are idiots.

utterance.speaker: CAMERON
utterance.content: Why? Because we stayed up all night doing exactly what you told us to do?

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: No. Because you stayed up all night doing exactly what I told you to do and have nothing to show for it.

utterance.speaker: FOREMAN
utterance.content: We eliminated dozens of wrong answers.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: I asked you what 2 + 2 equals and a day later you tell me not 25.

utterance.speaker: CHASE
utterance.content: The pathology report just got filed. Found granulomas in Lucy's pericardium. Could be a case of fungal infection.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Nice work.

utterance.speaker: CAMERON
utterance.content: He went home!

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Work smart, not hard. Find out which fungus, biopsy a lymph node. Take employee of the month with you.

utterance.speaker: CAMERON
utterance.content: I would rather Foreman...

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: I know.

utterance.speaker: LUCY
utterance.content: I don't want any more shots.

utterance.speaker: JASPER
utterance.content: I don't want any more shots.

utterance.speaker: DERAN
utterance.content: Jasper. Look at me, Goosy. Squeeze my hand, ok?

utterance.speaker: CHASE
utterance.content: This will tell us why you are sick so we can make you all better.

utterance.speaker: DERAN
utterance.content: Where would she pick up a fungus?

utterance.speaker: CAMERON
utterance.content: Anywhere moist. Around a pool, locker room, public shower...

utterance.speaker: DERAN
utterance.content: She doesn't have any gym or swim classes, she doesn't even like to play with kids outside.

utterance.speaker: CAMERON
utterance.content: You haven't taken any trips, gone anywhere new?

utterance.speaker: DERAN
utterance.content: It's been hard to get away, since their mom...

utterance.speaker: JASPER
utterance.content: Our mom's dead.

utterance.speaker: CAMERON
utterance.content: I'm sorry.

utterance.speaker: DERAN
utterance.content: Last year, brain cancer.

utterance.speaker: JASPER
utterance.content: You're going to stick that thing in her arm? Cool!

utterance.speaker: CAMERON
utterance.content: The cool part is, your sister won't feel a thing.

utterance.speaker: JASPER
utterance.content: Nice necklace.

utterance.speaker: CAMERON
utterance.content: Thanks.

utterance.speaker: JASPER
utterance.content: You like video games?

utterance.speaker: CAMERON
utterance.content: Love them.

utterance.speaker: CHASE
utterance.content: That should do it. You OK?

utterance.speaker: LUCY
utterance.content: I want my bunny.

utterance.speaker: DERAN
utterance.content: Are you being silly?

utterance.speaker: LUCY
utterance.content: I didn't know which one to take.

utterance.speaker: DERAN
utterance.content: What do you mean? What's happening?

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: So, what does the double vision tell us?

utterance.speaker: CAMERON
utterance.content: Slit lamp revealed the eyeâ€™s anterior chamber is swollen, uveitis, means it's not a post op effect and it's not neurological.

utterance.speaker: CHASE
utterance.content: It's not fungal either, lymph node biopsy was clean.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: So we're back to square one.

utterance.speaker: FOREMAN
utterance.content: One and a half. We've eliminated two more conditions.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Yes, 2+2 doesn't equal 12 or 16 either.

utterance.speaker: FOREMAN
utterance.content: Vision issues plus screwy heart equals some type of autoimmune. Lupus and Kawasakis are the most common in a 6-year-old.

utterance.speaker: CHASE
utterance.content: Yeah, tough to find a 6 year old who doesn't have Lupus or Kawasakis.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Did you look at her knees?

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Those knobby things in the middle of her legs, any scars or scabs?

utterance.speaker: FOREMAN
utterance.content: What does that have to do with...

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Well most 6 year olds hurt themselves, a lot. Crash their bikes, climb trees, bungee jump.

utterance.speaker: DERAN
utterance.content: Dad said she doesn't like to run around outside.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Because running around outside hurts.

utterance.speaker: CAMERON
utterance.content: She didn't mention anything about...

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Most 6 year olds are not familiar with the phrase 'my joints feel inflamed'. So, 2+2 equals?

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Juvenile Rheumatoid Arthritis. We're checking her ANA to confirm and giving her steroids to fix her vision. Some idiot gave me two tickets for a play tonight. Saved his life, apparently worth 186 dollars. Sorry, had to take a leak.

utterance.speaker: WILSON
utterance.content: Oh I didn't know you were seeing a patient.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: It's an exam room. What did you think I was doing?

utterance.speaker: WILSON
utterance.content: What you usually do - hiding from Cuddy.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Well it'd be stupid to do it in here. There's a patient in here. You been drinking more?

utterance.speaker: EDDIE
utterance.content: Ah no, I, I....

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Guy's peeing all the time. Play. Interested?

utterance.speaker: WILSON
utterance.content: Sure, want me to pick you up?

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: I'm not going.

utterance.speaker: WILSON
utterance.content: You said two tickets.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: You thought this was a date? Any other symptoms?

utterance.speaker: EDDIE
utterance.content: My stomach hurts, I have back pain and muscle aches, I feel dizzy and I have trouble concentrating sometimes in class.

utterance.speaker: WILSON
utterance.content: I really shouldn't...

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: You want the tickets or not?

utterance.speaker: WILSON
utterance.content: Why don't you want to go with me?

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: It's a play. Dudes only go to plays if they're dragged by women they're hoping to see naked.

utterance.speaker: WILSON
utterance.content: So why are you giving them to me?

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Maybe there's someone you want to see naked.

utterance.speaker: WILSON
utterance.content: All right.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Any fever?

utterance.speaker: EDDIE
utterance.content: No.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Anything in your pee other than pee?

utterance.speaker: EDDIE
utterance.content: No.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: I'm going to need a urine sample.

utterance.speaker: EDDIE
utterance.content: No!

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Yeah that last one wasn't a question. You might have diabetes...

utterance.speaker: EDDIE
utterance.content: I can't pee in public.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: We have bathrooms.

utterance.speaker: EDDIE
utterance.content: I can't pee in public bathrooms.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Where can you pee?

utterance.speaker: EDDIE
utterance.content: I only live a few miles from here.

utterance.speaker: DERAN
utterance.content: I though arthritis was for old people.

utterance.speaker: FOREMAN
utterance.content: JRA is an autoimmune disease. Her body is attacking itself, causing inflammation in the joints, her eyes and her heart.

utterance.speaker: DERAN
utterance.content: Is it treatable?

utterance.speaker: FOREMAN
utterance.content: It can be crippling, but it can also go into complete remission. The good thing is we caught it early. It gives her the best chance to have a positive outcome.

utterance.speaker: DERAN
utterance.content: Don't get up, Goosy, your stitches.

utterance.speaker: FOREMAN
utterance.content: She's having a stroke.

utterance.speaker: FOREMAN
utterance.content: The stroke was caused by a clot in her middle cerebral artery. Started her on TPA. It should dissolve the clot and hopefully prevent brain damage, but we wont know for sure until she regains consciousness.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Or she has another stroke. Arthritis, heart disease, why can't this kid act her age?

utterance.speaker: FOREMAN
utterance.content: JRA doesn't affect the blood, means the clotâ€™s a symptom of something else.

utterance.speaker: CAMERON
utterance.content: It's a symptom of polycythemia, she's fully hydrated and her blood's still thicker than pancake batter.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Well thick blood explains the stroke, could also have caused an autoimmune response, which would explain the JRA kicking into gear. But what explains the thick blood?

utterance.speaker: FOREMAN
utterance.content: Lack of oxygen, forces the body to over produce red cells.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: What explains the lack of oxygen?

utterance.speaker: CHASE
utterance.content: Carbon monoxide fumes, cigarette smoke.

utterance.speaker: CAMERON
utterance.content: Doubt our patient's a smoker.

utterance.speaker: CHASE
utterance.content: Dad could be.

utterance.speaker: CAMERON
utterance.content: He's not.

utterance.speaker: CHASE
utterance.content: He says he's not.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Hey! Don't make me turn the hose on you two. Chase is right. You two go check the house, see if Dad's a closet Marlboro man.

utterance.speaker: CAMERON
utterance.content: You're intentionally punishing us.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: By making you do your job? Does seem kind of cruel doesn't it? Take along a carbon monoxide detector to check for leaks and you start her on hydroxyurea to control her red blood cell production. Take out a Merck Manual, medieval edition, tell you how to drain a pint or two so she doesn't clot again.

utterance.speaker: JASPER
utterance.content: Dr. Cameron! I got you flowers, for helping my sister.

utterance.speaker: CAMERON
utterance.content: That's so sweet.

utterance.speaker: CHASE
utterance.content: Does your dad know you're down here?

utterance.speaker: JASPER
utterance.content: Yes.

utterance.speaker: CHASE
utterance.content: Congratulations on your bundle of joy. Something you forgot to tell me?

utterance.speaker: CAMERON
utterance.content: You should take these back to where you found them.

utterance.speaker: JASPER
utterance.content: Okay.

utterance.speaker: CHASE
utterance.content: Excuse me? Can you make sure these flowers and this kid both get back to where they belong?

utterance.speaker: SECURITY GUARD
utterance.content: Sure.

utterance.speaker: CHASE
utterance.content: Thanks.

utterance.speaker: SECURITY GUARD
utterance.content: Lets go. C 'mon.

utterance.speaker: CAMERON
utterance.content: Wait.

utterance.speaker: DERAN
utterance.content: So you're just draining blood from her? You're not testing it, you're not fixing it?

utterance.speaker: FOREMAN
utterance.content: Your daughters vascular system is engorged with blood, draining some reduces the chances of another stroke. We're also starting her on a drug that suppresses the production of red cells so we don't have to keep doing this. Good chance she'll make a full recovery.

utterance.speaker: DERAN
utterance.content: She hasn't spoken yet.

utterance.speaker: FOREMAN
utterance.content: Give her time.

utterance.speaker: SECURITY GUARD
utterance.content: This your boy?

utterance.speaker: DERAN
utterance.content: Where have you been?

utterance.speaker: JASPER
utterance.content: Exploring. Seeya.

utterance.speaker: DERAN
utterance.content: Thank you. You know you just can't run off without telling me.

utterance.speaker: JASPER
utterance.content: Ok. Can I have two dollars?

utterance.speaker: CHASE
utterance.content: Oven's a long shot. You'd smell the gas long before anyone got sick.

utterance.speaker: CAMERON
utterance.content: Yeah right, House loves it when we skip something because it's a long shot.

utterance.speaker: CHASE
utterance.content: Why did you take the flower? Why'd you kiss him?

utterance.speaker: CAMERON
utterance.content: He did something sweet.

utterance.speaker: CHASE
utterance.content: He STOLE flowers!

utterance.speaker: CAMERON
utterance.content: He's eight.

utterance.speaker: CHASE
utterance.content: You're trying to make me jealous.

utterance.speaker: CAMERON
utterance.content: Yeah, I want you to profess your love for me. Oh wait, you already did that and it caused me to end our relationship.

utterance.speaker: CHASE
utterance.content: You're enabling a thief. And a delinquent! Letters from school, fights, detentions, a parent conference. Oh, I know, I know, bad boys are hard to resist.

utterance.speaker: CAMERON
utterance.content: It's a crush. It's harmless.

utterance.speaker: CHASE
utterance.content: It's never harmless.

utterance.speaker: CAMERON
utterance.content: So I'm learning.

utterance.speaker: CHASE
utterance.content: So this is us now? We snipe at each other?

utterance.speaker: CAMERON
utterance.content: I'm not sniping I'm looking for a vent. Her room's directly above the garage. There's all sorts of CO sources down there. I found a vent, I think there's something in it.

utterance.speaker: CHASE
utterance.content: This isn't right. You dumped me, you don't get to be mad.

utterance.speaker: CAMERON
utterance.content: We had a really good thing. You broke the rules, I'm angry. I'll get over it.

utterance.speaker: CAMERON
utterance.content: She's being abused.

utterance.speaker: FOREMAN
utterance.content: A bloody t-shirt doesn't equal abuse. Kids get hurt all the time.

utterance.speaker: CHASE
utterance.content: That amount of blood?

utterance.speaker: FOREMAN
utterance.content: Oh crap. You two are agreeing again.

utterance.speaker: CAMERON
utterance.content: Father's overwhelmed, hectic job, his wife passed away last year. He could easily be taking it out on the kids.

utterance.speaker: FOREMAN
utterance.content: Or she had a nosebleed and grabbed a t-shirt.

utterance.speaker: CHASE
utterance.content: She's so ashamed of a nosebleed she has to hide the evidence in a vent under her bed?

utterance.speaker: CAMERON
utterance.content: She's socially isolated, the brother's always in trouble its classic signs...

utterance.speaker: FOREMAN
utterance.content: But no physical signs. No marks on her body, no bruises at all.

utterance.speaker: CAMERON
utterance.content: What if it's sexual? We should call social services.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Well this sucks. Either it's abuse or it's not abuse. Which means either it's a symptom or it's completely irrelevant. Either way we have to waste half a day figuring out which. Full physical exam. Look for bruises we may have missed, check her mouth and do a vaginal exam.

utterance.speaker: CHASE
utterance.content: We can't do a vaginal exam on a 6 year old without the Dad's consent and if he's abusing her he'll never say yes.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Never is just reven spelt backwards.

utterance.speaker: FOREMAN
utterance.content: Have you been abusing your daughter?

utterance.speaker: DERAN
utterance.content: What? Why would you...

utterance.speaker: FOREMAN
utterance.content: We found this. Hidden in a vent under her bed.

utterance.speaker: DERAN
utterance.content: I don't know anything about this. Maybe she had a bloody nose?

utterance.speaker: FOREMAN
utterance.content: We need to examine her for abuse.

utterance.speaker: DERAN
utterance.content: You can't really think that I...

utterance.speaker: FOREMAN
utterance.content: Maybe you, maybe the school bully, maybe the creepy neighbour. I'm guessing that you're not paying as much attention as you should be. Do you even know where your son is right now?

utterance.speaker: DERAN
utterance.content: Yeah he was here just... a minute ago. She isn't being abused.

utterance.speaker: FOREMAN
utterance.content: Unfortunately that answer doesn't help me. If you have abused her you're obviously going to lie.

utterance.speaker: DERAN
utterance.content: I'm not lying!

utterance.speaker: FOREMAN
utterance.content: We need to do a vaginal exam.

utterance.speaker: DERAN
utterance.content: No. She may be dying, she still can't talk and you're going to waste your time with THIS?

utterance.speaker: FOREMAN
utterance.content: You consent and we waste a few hours doing an exam or you refuse and I call social services, and they waste three days doing an investigation, which ends with them doing the exam anyway.

utterance.speaker: CAMERON
utterance.content: Ok, I'm going to look inside your mouth, open wide. Ok, I'm going to look at your chest and your back next. Ok? I know you can't talk so stop me if you get scared. Before you came here, did anyone hurt you? Make you bleed? I need to look in your vagina now, do you understand? I'm a doctor so it's ok, all right? Bend your knees, keep your ankles together and just let your knees fall to the side, ok? Oh my God.

utterance.speaker: CAMERON
utterance.content: She has cuts all over her genital area, like slices, some are almost healed but some are new.

utterance.speaker: CHASE
utterance.content: She could be doing it to herself.

utterance.speaker: FOREMAN
utterance.content: She's a little young to be cutting.

utterance.speaker: CHASE
utterance.content: She's a little young for a stroke. Depression accounts for the cuts, molestation accounts for the depression.

utterance.speaker: FOREMAN
utterance.content: But do the cuts account for all that blood?

utterance.speaker: CAMERON
utterance.content: They weren't deep enough.

utterance.speaker: CHASE
utterance.content: So she's getting cut but that's not the source of the blood?

utterance.speaker: FOREMAN
utterance.content: The other obvious source is forcible penetration.

utterance.speaker: CHASE
utterance.content: The other obvious source of the blood, not the cuts.

utterance.speaker: CAMERON
utterance.content: And there was no tearing, there's no evidence at all.

utterance.speaker: CHASE
utterance.content: So we have no explanation for the cuts or the blood. Where is he?

utterance.speaker: FOREMAN
utterance.content: What if our original assumption was wrong?

utterance.speaker: CAMERON
utterance.content: Meaning what?

utterance.speaker: FOREMAN
utterance.content: We found a t-shirt covered with blood hidden in a heating vent. How do we know it's even hers?

utterance.speaker: CHASE
utterance.content: Her Dad identified it.

utterance.speaker: FOREMAN
utterance.content: Not the shirt. The blood.

utterance.speaker: EDDIE
utterance.content: Are those the urine test results?

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Yes.

utterance.speaker: EDDIE
utterance.content: Andâ€¦

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: I'm going to ask you for some blood.

utterance.speaker: EDDIE
utterance.content: Why?

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: To see if your answer will be 'I can't bleed in public'. This wasn't your urine was it?

utterance.speaker: EDDIE
utterance.content: Why would I give you someone else's urine?

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Usual reason is because you're on steroids.

utterance.speaker: EDDIE
utterance.content: I'm not an athlete.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Duh. The second favourite reason is because you're on drugs.

utterance.speaker: EDDIE
utterance.content: I'm not.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: I am. Third favourite reason is â€” you have insurance but your friend, Eggs Benedict, doesn't. So Eggs describes a list of symptoms and you repeat them to a doctor. Which is particularly stupid because this is a free clinic.

utterance.speaker: CUDDY
utterance.content: Need you, now.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: My work here is done.

utterance.speaker: EDDIE
utterance.content: Amâ€¦ Iâ€¦ ok? Is it diabetes?

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: No, you're pregnant.

utterance.speaker: CUDDY
utterance.content: 6-year-old abuse victim and you haven't called social services?

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: She might have been abused. That's horrifying. Why are you wearing extra concealer under your eyes?

utterance.speaker: CUDDY
utterance.content: The law's clear, you suspect abuse you call the authorities. You don't proceed as usual while the possible abuser sits by her bedside.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Dad consented to the exam, which means it's not the Dad. How late were you out last night?

utterance.speaker: CUDDY
utterance.content: It's always the Dad and I don't have a curfew.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Panty hamster get a spin on its wheel?

utterance.speaker: CUDDY
utterance.content: I went to a play, House you are going back to your office, you are picking up your phone, calling social services and you are reporting suspected abuse. Do you understand?

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: What play?

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: You're trying to have sex with Cuddy.

utterance.speaker: WILSON
utterance.content: Fries?

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: You took her to a play. You only take women to plays because...

utterance.speaker: WILSON
utterance.content: No, YOU only take women to plays for that reason. That's your theory.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Ok, then why did you take her to a play?

utterance.speaker: WILSON
utterance.content: She's a friend.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: A friend with a squish mitten.

utterance.speaker: WILSON
utterance.content: It is possible to have a friend of the opposite sex without...

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Blasphemer! She's not a friend of the opposite sex, she's a different species. She's an administrator. She's going to eat your head after she's done.

utterance.speaker: WILSON
utterance.content: Yes, I slept with her.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Seriously?

utterance.speaker: WILSON
utterance.content: No.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Yes you did.

utterance.speaker: WILSON
utterance.content: Yes I did.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Seriously?

utterance.speaker: WILSON
utterance.content: No. You've got a problem House.

utterance.speaker: FOREMAN
utterance.content: We just tested the blood on Lucy's t-shirt. It's full of endometrial cells.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: It's not her blood.

utterance.speaker: FOREMAN
utterance.content: We tested that too. It is.

utterance.speaker: WILSON
utterance.content: Your 6-year-old patient?

utterance.speaker: FOREMAN
utterance.content: It's menstrual blood. She's started puberty.

utterance.speaker: DERAN
utterance.content: How can someone start puberty before they even start the first grade? She was in diapers two years ago.

utterance.speaker: CAMERON
utterance.content: For some reason her body has too much sex hormone. Caused her reproductive system to get confused, start operating prematurely. We need to find out the source of the hormones and cut it off.

utterance.speaker: DERAN
utterance.content: She's so young. I haven't even talked to her about sex. I doubt she even knows what a period is... Girls talk to their moms about that. You're going to be ok, Goosy. I love you.

utterance.speaker: LUCY
utterance.content: I... want... juice.

utterance.speaker: CAMERON
utterance.content: She got her period and didn't know what it was. She was scared and confused. A friend told her to put a t-shirt in her underwear. When she started growing pubic hair, she snuck Daddy's razor and tried to shave it off.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Apparently forgot to sneak the shaving cream.

utterance.speaker: FOREMAN
utterance.content: A tumour's most likely. A pituitary adenoma would send her hormone levels sky high.

utterance.speaker: CAMERON
utterance.content: In Puerto Rico in the 70s there was an epidemic of kids growing breasts because of estrogen in the poultry.

utterance.speaker: CHASE
utterance.content: If it was in the food it would be an epidemic. We've got one kid.

utterance.speaker: CAMERON
utterance.content: She's 6. She's tiny. She lives on chicken fingers and milk. Dad doesn't look like the type to read labels. He's probably buying stuff packed full of hormones.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Excellent argument. It's a tumour.

utterance.speaker: CAMERON
utterance.content: There's all sorts of environmental sources. Pesticides, soy productsâ€¦ Some shampoos are basically a placenta in a bottle.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: If the tumour's not in her brain it's in her reproductive tract. Get an MRI.

utterance.speaker: CAMERON
utterance.content: Can I at least...

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Waste your time? Wouldn't recognise you if you didn't.

utterance.speaker: FOREMAN
utterance.content: Frontal cortex is clean. Moving caudally.

utterance.speaker: CHASE
utterance.content: For the record, Cameron's the one who broke it off.

utterance.speaker: FOREMAN
utterance.content: Not interested. No masses in the hypothalamus.

utterance.speaker: CHASE
utterance.content: I wanted more. She didn't share my feelings.

utterance.speaker: FOREMAN
utterance.content: I feel like I'm in a similar position.

utterance.speaker: CHASE
utterance.content: Pituitary's clean.

utterance.speaker: FOREMAN
utterance.content: You're an idiot. Either she's lying or she's actually emotionally detached. Which one sounds more like Cameron to you?

utterance.speaker: CHASE
utterance.content: Neither.

utterance.speaker: FOREMAN
utterance.content: You have to choose one. There's a bright spot on her left ovary. Looks like a solid tumour.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: They printed my letter.

utterance.speaker: WILSON
utterance.content: You were right.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Of course I was. What are we talking about? They printed my letter.

utterance.speaker: WILSON
utterance.content: Great. Cuddy.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: You want to see her naked.

utterance.speaker: WILSON
utterance.content: No, no, no. She wants to see ME naked. She sent me flowers.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Just thanking you for the play. You see some people fell an emotion called gratitude.

utterance.speaker: WILSON
utterance.content: There's a card.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: I suspected. Explains how you knew who they were from.

utterance.speaker: WILSON
utterance.content: Lets do it again. Soon. X X. Lisa. Xs are the kisses right?

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Noâ€¦ I think they're the hugs. I think Os are the kisses.

utterance.speaker: WILSON
utterance.content: No, no, Xs are definitely the kisses. Soon is its own sentence. I got to go.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: I'll miss you. You were a good friend. They printed my letter. How was the play Mrs. Lincoln?

utterance.speaker: CUDDY
utterance.content: What's up with Wilson?

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: He's just a little freaked.

utterance.speaker: CUDDY
utterance.content: Why?

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: I sent him flowers.

utterance.speaker: CAMERON
utterance.content: Jasper, you're not supposed to be up here.

utterance.speaker: JASPER
utterance.content: Is that other doctor your boyfriend?

utterance.speaker: CAMERON
utterance.content: No. Your Dad's probably looking for you. He's got enough to worry about right now.

utterance.speaker: JASPER
utterance.content: Do you like him?

utterance.speaker: CAMERON
utterance.content: He's a friend.

utterance.speaker: JASPER
utterance.content: Do you LIKE him like him?

utterance.speaker: CAMERON
utterance.content: We should get you back to your Dad. Let me put this down and I'll take you there.

utterance.speaker: JASPER
utterance.content: I could be your boyfriend.

utterance.speaker: CAMERON
utterance.content: Iâ€¦ think that wouldn't be fair to the girls your own age.

utterance.speaker: JASPER
utterance.content: He seems like a tool.

utterance.speaker: CAMERON
utterance.content: He's not. And that's rude. I'm taking you back to your father.

utterance.speaker: FOREMAN
utterance.content: The mass is small. About a centimetre across.

utterance.speaker: CHASE
utterance.content: Firing the biopsy needle.

utterance.speaker: FOREMAN
utterance.content: You nick an artery?

utterance.speaker: CHASE
utterance.content: No.

utterance.speaker: FOREMAN
utterance.content: She's in VTAC, no pulse. Charging 50! Clear! Clear! Clear!

utterance.speaker: CHASE
utterance.content: The arrhythmia must've been a reaction to the hydroxyurea. We have to stop the drug therapy.

utterance.speaker: CAMERON
utterance.content: The bone marrow will just go back to over producing blood cells. She'll keep having strokes and we'll have to keep bleeding her, forever.

utterance.speaker: CHASE
utterance.content: You resect the tumour, hormones levels go back to normal and her symptoms go away.

utterance.speaker: FOREMAN
utterance.content: Great plan. Except the fact that her tumour's not a tumour. It's a benign cyst.

utterance.speaker: CAMERON
utterance.content: If it's not a tumour that just leaves an environmental source.

utterance.speaker: FOREMAN
utterance.content: I'm feeling another late night... I'm gonna leave you two alone.

utterance.speaker: CAMERON
utterance.content: You're kidding me right?

utterance.speaker: FOREMAN
utterance.content: What? The answer's right there, it's just a question of finding it. You don't need me for that.

utterance.speaker: CAMERON
utterance.content: Don't get the mochachino. They screwed up and put hot chocolate in the dispenser.

utterance.speaker: CHASE
utterance.content: Thank you.

utterance.speaker: CAMERON
utterance.content: You were right. That eight-year-old kid grabbed my ass. I shouldn't have encouraged him.

utterance.speaker: CHASE
utterance.content: Well, I was a boy once. I know how they think.

utterance.speaker: CAMERON
utterance.content: You were a pervert at 8?

utterance.speaker: CHASE
utterance.content: Maybe... 11.

utterance.speaker: CAMERON
utterance.content: I didn't realise you were going to get hurt. I'm sorry I misled you.

utterance.speaker: CHASE
utterance.content: You didn't. You have feelings for me. You come back to me again and again.

utterance.speaker: CAMERON
utterance.content: For sex. It's a simple, physical...

utterance.speaker: CHASE
utterance.content: C'mon, you have feelings for puppies and patients that you barely know, but when it comes to a guy that you've worked with for 3 years? Had sex with, spent the night with, you're telling me you feel nothing? Absolutely nothing?

utterance.speaker: JASPER
utterance.content: Get away from her! Don't touch her! I'll kill you if you touch her.

utterance.speaker: CAMERON
utterance.content: Jasper!

utterance.speaker: CHASE
utterance.content: Get him off! AHH! He's biting me! Get him off! AHH!

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Somebody better be dying.

utterance.speaker: CAMERON
utterance.content: Lucy's big brother's got a crush on me so he bit the crap out of Chase.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: And I care because?

utterance.speaker: CHASE
utterance.content: Just thought you might want to know when one of your employees gets attacked by a sociopath.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Bees or monkeys yes, sociopaths no.

utterance.speaker: CAMERON
utterance.content: Hello?

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: He's not a sociopath.

utterance.speaker: CAMERON
utterance.content: How do you know?

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: He's acting logically. He's got a crush on you. He's being aggressive about it. Not just regular aggressive. He's out of his mind on hormones aggressive.

utterance.speaker: CHASE
utterance.content: You think he's...

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Better figure out what's killing the girl cause her brother's got it too.

utterance.speaker: CHASE
utterance.content: Jasper's got 100 times more testosterone than a healthy 8-year-old. But we scanned his brain and reproductive tract, no hormone secreting tumours.

utterance.speaker: FOREMAN
utterance.content: Not surprised. What's more likely? Brother and sister get the same type of tumour at exactly the same time or they both play in the same toxic sandbox?

utterance.speaker: CAMERON
utterance.content: Yes you would think that if for some reason you were completely unaware of the fact that we spent the entire night testing everything from that home. It was all negative.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: You went home? Good for you. Delegate.

utterance.speaker: CAMERON
utterance.content: We're not his subordinates.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Making it all the more impressive.

utterance.speaker: CHASE
utterance.content: What if it's genetic? What, anyone else think it's more than a coincidence these kids have symptoms that could be caused by a brain tumour which is exactly what killed their mum?

utterance.speaker: FOREMAN
utterance.content: You just said there were no tumours. We scanned both their brains.

utterance.speaker: CHASE
utterance.content: They looked clean. So did their mum's until it didn't.

utterance.speaker: CAMERON
utterance.content: It can't be genetic. Mom had none of the same symptoms.

utterance.speaker: CHASE
utterance.content: Yes she did, if the symptoms were pubic hair and menstruation.

utterance.speaker: CAMERON
utterance.content: That's ridiculous. If menstruation is a symptom of brain cancer then I should be on chemo right now.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: That's ridiculous. You're way too skinny to be menstruating.

utterance.speaker: CHASE
utterance.content: What if the mum had other problems? Symptoms her doctors ignored on account of the fact she was already dying.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Pull all of her medical records, find any similarities to our patients, and punch the little brat on the nose so he doesn't have a stroke like his sister.

utterance.speaker: JASPER
utterance.content: I'm not sick.

utterance.speaker: FOREMAN
utterance.content: Just trying to keep you that way.

utterance.speaker: JASPER
utterance.content: I want Dr. Cameron to do mine.

utterance.speaker: FOREMAN
utterance.content: Trust me, you don't want her cutting you right now.

utterance.speaker: DERAN
utterance.content: So Jasper's behavioural issues?

utterance.speaker: FOREMAN
utterance.content: Could be a function of the increased testosterone. Hopefully, he'll be a delight, as soon as we figure this out.

utterance.speaker: LUCY
utterance.content: My tummy hurts, it hurts!

utterance.speaker: JASPER
utterance.content: No it doesn't. Don't be such a baby.

utterance.speaker: LUCY
utterance.content: My tummy hurts!

utterance.speaker: FOREMAN
utterance.content: Where on your tummy?

utterance.speaker: LUCY
utterance.content: It hurts! It hurts!

utterance.speaker: FOREMAN
utterance.content: Stomach pain is from a cyst in her pancreas. Found two more in her kidneys and one in her lung. They weren't there 48 hours ago. The hormones are making her body go haywire.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: If she gets one in her brain or heart, she's dead. No pressure though.

utterance.speaker: CHASE
utterance.content: Mum was perfectly healthy until she got cancer. She had none of the symptoms the kids have.

utterance.speaker: CAMERON
utterance.content: It's not genetic. It's not environmental. It's got to be a pituitary adenoma.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Yes, that would make complete sense if they had one.

utterance.speaker: CAMERON
utterance.content: Just because we haven't found anything on the scan doesn't mean it's not there. We should remove her pituitary gland.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Two siblings, same condition. Its got to be genetic or environmental. If you add in â€˜same timeâ€™ and we're back to just environmental.

utterance.speaker: CHASE
utterance.content: Yes and that would make complete sense if there was anything in her environment.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Just because we haven't found anything yet.

utterance.speaker: FOREMAN
utterance.content: She's been out of her environment for 4 days and she's still getting worse.

utterance.speaker: CAMERON
utterance.content: I'm getting the father's consent.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: No! We have no evidence.

utterance.speaker: CAMERON
utterance.content: This is YOUR process House. You asked us what 2 + 2 is, we've eliminated every number except for 4. She needs brain surgery.

utterance.speaker: CAMERON
utterance.content: The ovaries produce sex hormones in response to a signal from the pituitary gland. Since we know the ovaries are fine the most likely cause...

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Most likely means she wants to root around inside your little girl's brain without any guarantee that it will work, that's why she's holding off on doing your son.

utterance.speaker: CAMERON
utterance.content: Dr. House knows that unfortunately we've ruled out every other option. We need to resect Lucy's pituitary before...

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Who else visits these kids?

utterance.speaker: CAMERON
utterance.content: They don't have any family in town.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: You got a girlfriend?

utterance.speaker: DERAN
utterance.content: No one visits.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: School?

utterance.speaker: CAMERON
utterance.content: They don't go to the same school, House I...

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Nanny?

utterance.speaker: CAMERON
utterance.content: They don't have one.

utterance.speaker: DERAN
utterance.content: They go to an after school day care but none of the other kids are sick.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Yet. It took your son twice as long to develop symptoms as your daughter, maybe the other kids are just slow.

utterance.speaker: CAMERON
utterance.content: We wait and your daughter may die.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: She does this and your daughter will need hormone replacement therapy for the rest of her life.

utterance.speaker: CAMERON
utterance.content: The treatments are extremely effective. She should lead a relatively normal life.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: And isn't that every parents dream, to have a kid grow up to be relatively normal.

utterance.speaker: CAMERON
utterance.content: My husband died of thyroid cancer that metastasised to his brain. I've been there. I know how terrifying this can be. I am telling you this is your best chance to save your daughterâ€™s life.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: You did NOT just play the dead husband card. My wife died because she signed a consent form that I didn't want her to sign. Died.

utterance.speaker: CAMERON
utterance.content: Thank you.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: How did you know?

utterance.speaker: DERAN
utterance.content: Know what?

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: That the other kids weren't sick. You've been here for 4 days.

utterance.speaker: DERAN
utterance.content: I just... I would've heard.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Right...

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Do you have hair on your special place?

utterance.speaker: LITTLE GIRL
utterance.content: Miss Janie!

utterance.speaker: JANIE
utterance.content: Can I help you?

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: I'm a doctor. Two of your kids are sick and I need to know why.

utterance.speaker: JANIE
utterance.content: You think they got sick here?

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: I think you're dating their Dad.

utterance.speaker: JANIE
utterance.content: He told you?

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: No, but I don't really care why he didn't. I just need to know how often you go to their house and what you bring.

utterance.speaker: JANIE
utterance.content: I don't.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Shampoos, fancy soaps, kids get in your bag?

utterance.speaker: JANIE
utterance.content: I've never been to their house. They just lost their mom, and we thought it was too soon. Why are you staring at me?

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Lip wax?

utterance.speaker: JANIE
utterance.content: I just had it done over lunch.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Mani-pedi?

utterance.speaker: JANIE
utterance.content: No, just the wax.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Women get a wax as part of a whole self-indulgent beauty ritual â€” pedicure, steam, cucumber masks. No one runs out at lunch just to get a lip wax, unless you woke up looking like Yosemite Sam.

utterance.speaker: JANIE
utterance.content: You're an ass.

utterance.speaker: CAMERON
utterance.content: Cameron.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: It's always the Dad.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Excess facial hair in women, it's a clear sign of hormonal imbalance, exactly what the little kiddies have.

utterance.speaker: DERAN
utterance.content: Is there something wrong at the Day Care Centre?

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: There's something wrong in your pants.

utterance.speaker: DERAN
utterance.content: Oh... She's a lot younger than I am, I... use a male enhancement cream to keep up with her. What does this have to do with...

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Never occurred to you to get a prescription instead of some penis pumper loaded with testosterone?

utterance.speaker: DERAN
utterance.content: I keep it at the gym. I apply it daily in the shower just like it says on the bottle. It's never been in my home. It's obviously never been near the kids.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: But you have.

utterance.speaker: DERAN
utterance.content: We've been through that I'm not a pervert or a paedophile.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: 30% of our waste is excreted through our skin. That sounds high. That's why you stink after eating garlic. Jack waters his beanstalk everyday for a week and he's oozing bean curd out of his pores for a month. Every time you gave the little tykes a hug you gave them a dose of testosterone, small for you but more then their little bodies could handle.

utterance.speaker: DERAN
utterance.content: So... I did this to them? Just holding their hands?

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Uh-huh.

utterance.speaker: DERAN
utterance.content: If I stop using it?

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: You'll be floppy, they'll be fine. He'll still be eight.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: You ok?

utterance.speaker: WILSON
utterance.content: Yeah, I think so.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Talk to Cuddy?

utterance.speaker: WILSON
utterance.content: No, not yet! I don't know what to say.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Just... be straight with her.

utterance.speaker: WILSON
utterance.content: I'm not sure what that is. I... I can't stop thinking about her.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: In what way?

utterance.speaker: WILSON
utterance.content: Maybe she's right, maybe... maybe this is worth exploring?

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: You sure she feels...

utterance.speaker: WILSON
utterance.content: She sent me flowers! How do I do this? What do I say?

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Cameron would tell you to say how you feel. Me, I'd get her drunk.

utterance.speaker: WILSON
utterance.content: I'm not going to say anything. I'm just going to walk into her office, and I'm going to kiss her.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: That's... a bold move, Cuddy likes bold. Yeah, your right, if you spoke you'd say something stupid.

utterance.speaker: WILSON
utterance.content: Yeah. I mean I'll either get a girlfriend or get fired. Ok... yea... ok... You, you, you! You were going to let me do that?!

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Well you made a compelling argument.

utterance.speaker: WILSON
utterance.content: YOU sent those flowers to me!

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Yes, because, you took her to a play because actually you do want to march down there and kiss her.

utterance.speaker: WILSON
utterance.content: No! I don't!

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Yes you do.

utterance.speaker: WILSON
utterance.content: You're right.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Seriously?

utterance.speaker: WILSON
utterance.content: No. You're a jerk.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Night Wilson.

utterance.speaker: WILSON
utterance.content: Night House.

utterance.speaker: CAMERON
utterance.content: They're beautiful. I thought about what you said, and ... I really don't want a relationship with you.

utterance.speaker: CHASE
utterance.content: I know. I also know you like flowers.

utterance.speaker: CUDDY
utterance.content: I don't get the whole May - December thing.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Give him a break, it's May - October at worst.

utterance.speaker: CUDDY
utterance.content: Well why can't it be October - October?

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: May is when things start to get hot.

utterance.speaker: CUDDY
utterance.content: If that guy wasn't trying so hard to keep up with a women half his age he wouldn't have almost killed both his kids.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Guy gets a little something-something, couple of kids have to die, circle of life.

utterance.speaker: CUDDY
utterance.content: So many people, so much energy and drama just trying to find someone who's almost never the right person anyway. It just... shouldn't be so hard.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: I got tickets to a play...
